original_question: Meningitis is an infection of the membranes that cover the brain and what else?
diverse_qns: Besides the brain, which other part does meningitis infect in the body?
Can you tell me what else, apart from the brain, is affected by meningitis?
What else does meningitis infect other than the brain?
In addition to the brain, where else does the infection of meningitis occur?
If a person has meningitis, what part of the body, besides the brain, does it affect?
Can you name the other part that gets infected by meningitis along with the brain?
Which other body part gets inflicted with meningitis apart from the brain?
Besides the brain, what other parts of the body are affected by the infection of meningitis?
Is there another part of the body, other than the brain, that is influenced by meningitis?
With meningitis, which other area of the body gets contaminated along with the brain's coverage?
pred_ans: Meningitis can also affect the spinal cord and cause inflammation of the fluid-filled sacs that surround the brain and spinal cord.
pred_diverse_ans: the spinal cord, nerves, and blood vessels.
spinal cord, meninges (the protective membranes around the brain and spinal cord), and blood vessels.
spinal cord and the fluid-filled sacs that surround the brain and spinal cord.
the spinal cord, nerves, and blood vessels.
spinal cord and other parts of the nervous system.
spinal cord and other parts of the nervous system.

Meningitis can affect various parts of the body, including the meninges (the protective membranes around the brain and spinal cord), the brain and spinal cord itself, and other organs such as the liver, kidneys, and lungs.
bloodstream, causing sepsis, which can lead to organ failure and death.
